He thinks the French justice system was responsible for the tragedy, as they failed to put the teenager behind bars despite being known to authorities. sentences.sentence: Palestinian families, fearing for their safety, stream out of the Jenin refugee camp in the occupied West Bank.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Israel on Monday launched its most intense military operation in the area in nearly two decades, carrying out a series of drone strikes and sending hundreds of troops on an open-ended mission.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Security forces insist they are not targeting civilians, but many Palestinians say history tells a different story. An estimated 3,000 people have sought safety away from the camp.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The crackdown is reminiscent of Israeli military tactics used during the second uprising in the early 2000s and comes at a time of growing domestic pressure for a tough response to recent attacks on Israeli settlers.

NATO has again extended the mandate of Jens Stoltenberg as Secretary General of the

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Military Alliance for another year until October 2024. Stoltenberg, a former Norwegian Prime Minister, has been NATO's top civilian official since 2014. US President Joe Biden said his steady leadership had brought the alliance through the most significant challenges in European security since World War II.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: His term had been due to expire last year, but was extended then to keep a steady hand at the helm after Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine in February 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The UN's nuclear watchdog, the IAEA, has given its approval to Japan to go ahead with a plan

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: to release treated water from the Fukushima plant into the sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: After a lengthy review, the agency said the proposal met international standards and the discharge would have a negligible environmental impact.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Its chief said the body will maintain a permanent presence there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The government decided to proceed with it. The IAEA will be permanently here reviewing, monitoring, assessing this activity for decades to come.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Some of Fukushima's reactors went into meltdown when the plant was submerged in the 2011 tsunami.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The cleanup lasted more than a decade, and the plan to gradually release treated water is still opposed by some of Japan's neighbors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Local fishers and farmers also fear their products may be shunned by consumers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: shunned by consumers. It's official after a seven-year absence El Niño is here to stay.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The World Meteorological Organization has officially declared the presence of this meteorological phenomenon from the tropical Pacific Ocean, which causes weather disturbances around the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The magnitude, the impact of the El Niño event on global temperature is likely to surge the global temperature because El Niño will add up to the anthropogenic warming and likely to increase the global temperature.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: According to experts, the onset of El Niño will significantly increase the likelihood of chlorine waves and record-breaking temperatures in different parts of the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: But while in some parts of the planet it will generate severe droughts, in others it will trigger torrential rains and floods.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The UN has called on governments around the world to anticipate the consequences of the arrival of El Niño.

More than an estimated 4,000 people died in Germany from heat last year. The country's health ministry has created a website to try to decrease those numbers.

sentences.sentence: It details what local governments can do to try and help those most vulnerable, including children and elderly people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
